byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

abstract: mercy ships bill slated for House; Repr Hennings explains bill to House com; Repr Fish upholds it; 7,000 Amers offer asylum; 80 children, 1st group under Brit Govt plan, reach Canada; German U-boats delay plans
snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2--The Rules Committee voted permission today for early consideration on the floor of the House of Representatives of the Hennings bill to permit American ships to evacuate refugee children under 16 years of age from the war-torn ...

headline.main: RESCUE SHIP BILL SLATED FOR HOUSE; Rules Committee Agrees to Early Floor Action on Plan to Evacuate Children SENATE WAITS HULL VIEW Some Critics Say Safe Conduct Requirement Nullifies Idea --Sponsors Deny This

lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 2--The Rules Committee voted permission today for early consideration on the floor of the House of Representatives of the Hennings bill to permit American ships to evacuate refugee children under 16 years of age from the war-torn regions of the world. The bill would amend the Neutrality Act under which the proposed action would be illegal.
